agents

Class Portal

  • java.lang.Object
    • agents.MetaAgent
      • agents.Portal
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MonitorAgent

    public class Portal
extends MetaAgent
    A Portal MetaAgent whose main purpose is to redirect incoming messages to its children. The portal is required to receive messages and redirect them to the applicable children via the MetaAgent.canReceive(agents.Message) method that more concrete implementations of the class have overridden.

      • Fields inherited from class agents.MetaAgent

      protected boolean canReceive(Message message)
      Portals should be able to parse all message for the purposes of reading the recipient and passing it onto its sub-agents.

    • Method Detail

      • canReceive

        protected boolean canReceive(Message message)
        Portals should be able to parse all message for the purposes of reading the recipient and passing it onto its sub-agents.
        Overrides:
        canReceive in class MetaAgent
        Parameters:
        message - The message received.
        Returns:
        True.

      • execute

        protected void execute(Message message)
        Passes the message onto the respective sub-agent, finding it recursively by running this method on any sub-portals. Messages that cannot be sent will be dropped.
        Specified by:
        execute in class MetaAgent
        Parameters:
        message - The message to pass on.

      • handleMessage

        protected void handleMessage(Message message)
        Handles the message; running any specific code for the message, e.g. handling system messages.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to parse and handle the specifics of.

      • executeOnSubAgent

        protected void executeOnSubAgent(java.lang.String name,
                                 Message message)
        Runs the message on the sub-agent to this portal with the specified name; this is done by choosing the next portal or sub-agent via the routing table agents.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the target sub-agent to send the message to.
        message - The message to send to the sub-agent.

      • getSubAgentOrParent

        protected MetaAgent getSubAgentOrParent(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves a sub-agent via the routing table and the list of immediate children to find the client which best suits the name given. If the agent requested is the parent; it is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the agent to find.
        Returns:
        The MetaAgent or next portal which leads to the target.

      • addChild

        public void addChild(MetaAgent agent)
        Adds a Meta Agent as a direct child to the portal. This is added into a list of direct children. If a new child is added and there is a portal above this one; a System message is broadcasted outward to update the routing tables to apply the addition of this agent.
        Parameters:
        agent - The MetaAgent to add as a child of this portal.

      • getChildren

        protected java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,MetaAgent> getChildren()
        Returns the map of immediate children for this Portal. Changes to the values in this map may have adverse effects to how routing performs.
        Returns:
        The map of children.
